searchConfiguration.name: Illegal MongoDB access
searchConfiguration.description: The operation is forbidden because it gives direct access to MongoDB. Use MorphiaDAO's methods to achieve such accesses cleanly.

searchConfiguration.name: Joda-Time usage
searchConfiguration.description: Joda-Time is an abandomed project, use java.time instead
searchConfiguration.problemDescriptor: Joda-Time is an abandomed project, use java.time instead

searchConfiguration.name: LocalDate.now()
searchConfiguration.description:
LocalDate.now() will instantiate the LocalDate at the current machine's timezone => local and CI tests will differ. Use Instant.now().truncatedTo(ChronoUnit.DAYS) or LocalDate.now(ZoneOffset.UTC) instead.
Note: It is only acceptable to use LocalDate in these circumstances: 1) When demarking a particular point within an implicit timezone (merchant, UTC, etc). E.g. when querying a precomputed statistic particular to the merchant's timezone (this could be at any layer: controllers, services, DAOs, etc) 2) When needing to do some date shifting greater than days. E.g. when subtracting a month or a year
searchConfiguration.problemDescriptor: Use of machine's timezone for LocalDate.now()

searchConfiguration.name: LocalDateTime.now()
searchConfiguration.description:
LocalDateTime.now() will instantiate the LocalDateTime at the current machine's timezone => local and CI tests will differ. Use Instant.now() or LocalDateTime.now(ZoneOffset.UTC) instead.
Note: It is only acceptable to use LocalDateTime in these circumstances: 1) When demarking a particular point within an implicit timezone (merchant, UTC, etc). E.g. when querying a precomputed statistic particular to the merchant's timezone (this could be at any layer: controllers, services, DAOs, etc) 2) When needing to do some date shifting greater than days. E.g. when subtracting a month or a year
searchConfiguration.problemDescriptor: Use of machine's timezone for LocalDateTime.now()

searchConfiguration.name: DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance()
searchConfiguration.description: DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance() shouldn't be used directly, use com.nosto.utils.XMLUtils.newDocumentBuilder instead

searchConfiguration.name: Merchant field in non tenant-aware morphia entity
searchConfiguration.description: If entity contains merchant fiels consider using TenantAwareMorphiaEntity and TenantAwareMorphiaDAO in order to ensure correct tenant is used and for data cleanup upon merchant termination to work properly

searchConfiguration.name: Raw use of ObjectId.isValid
searchConfiguration.description: Raw use of ObjectId.isValid Use com.nosto.morphia.MongoUtils.isValidObjectId instead

searchConfiguration.name: ZoneId.systemDefault()
searchConfiguration.description: ZoneId.systemDefault() will be different in prod/CI and local-machines, resulting in differences in behavior that are difficult to predict and test => use only ZoneOffset.UTC instead

constraint.name: MethodCall

searchConfiguration.name: SimpleDateFormat
searchConfiguration.description: SimpleDateFormat is error-prone and was completely re-done (properly) with java.time
searchConfiguration.problemDescriptor: SimpleDateFormat is error-prone and was completely re-done (properly) with java.time

searchConfiguration.name: Use of Jupiter @Test
searchConfiguration.description: We do not use any Jupiter Test, don't mix them
searchConfiguration.problemDescriptor: Isn't it org.junit.Test what you intended to use?

searchConfiguration.name: NewRelicDeps
searchConfiguration.description: Relying on NewRelic's inner deps. Use the project's explicitely imported libs instead

option.value: Not exploitable: we run on 64bits-envs only
Hardly exploitable: used only from Velocity, which doesn't add the collection to itself
The attack-vector seems to be blocked by our SecureUberspector implementation (PublicFieldSecureUberspector)
